description.narrative: Assisting institutions to better manage protected areas and cleaning invasive species
independent political entity
Objective To expand and ensure effective management of the protected area network to safeguard threatened biodiversity
3 Financial sustainability score for national systems of protected areas

comment.narrative: Baseline application of the of the Financial Sustainability Scorecard 2009 yielded a general score of 17

Application of the of the Financial Sustainability Scorecard at project end is expected to yield a general score 3040
Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report

Target achieved Financial Scorecard has not been reworked for this reporting period Initiatives undertaken in 2013 and 2014 to improve the financial score of the PAs are still ongoing Private companies are still directly contributing to PAs management in terms of ecosystem restoration and IAS removal activities in the PAs The lions club a service group is channeling CSR funds from private companies for IAS clearing and forest restoration activities The Maurice Ile Durable has continued to fund PA management and Ecosystem restoration in newly identified areas There will soon be another source of funds from the European Union The Indian Ocean Commission IOC have called for proposal for local biodiversity project to the tune of US 36 000 to US 90 000 per projectDeadline for submission of Project is August 2015

Application of the of the Financial Sustainability Scorecard at project end is expected to yield a general score 3040

During the project preparation phase there was comprehensive application of the METT methodology across the entire PAN with the exception of forest reserves This note applies for all other subindicators under indicator 5
METT Score is more than 70 for conservation management areas

The METT Scores have not been worked out for this reporting periodCleared and restored areas have indeed expanded but will not have a major impact on the scores Though the METT is to recalculated at the end of the project the scores will be calculated again in 2016 by the CTA and PMU The latter will then update the METT on a regular basis and use this as a Monitoring and Evaluation tool

description.narrative: 1 Coverage ha of the terrestrial formal protected area network of mainland Mauritius and the islets

comment.narrative:
State protected areas
8027ha
Private protected areas
0ha

State protected areas
11700ha
Private protected areas
3220ha

The status quo in terms of protected areas has been maintained
State Protected areas 8328 ha
Private protected areas 0 ha
For Bassin Blanc acquisition under appeal in valuation tribunal is still not finalized
The management plans for the Bras dEau National Park and Black River Gorges National Park have been submitted during this reporting periodBoth document proposes the creation of buffer zones these will be delineated in the mapping under the Protected Area Network Expansion Strategy Yet the whole process of declaring the land around the parks must be initiated by the Ministry of Housing and Lands which is the local authority to define the land uses
Regarding Mountain and River Reserves which covers approximately 6500 ha of privately managed land their status as protected areas is still unclear The Protected Area Network Expansion Strategy expected for September 2015 will provide the underpinnings for adding these reserves and other potential reserves such as the corridor of 4000 metres linking Le Morne to the Black River Gorges National Park to the protected area networks
Concerning the Native Terrestrial Biodiversity and National Parks Bill which makes provision for proclamation of of private reserves is expected to be presented to the parliament in October 2015

State protected areas
11700ha
Private protected areas
3220ha

The status quo in terms of protected areas has been maintained
State Protected areas 8328 ha
Private protected areas 0 ha
For Bassin Blanc acquisition under appeal in valuation tribunal is still not finalized
The management plans for the Bras dEau National Park and Black River Gorges National Park have been submitted during this reporting periodBoth document proposes the creation of buffer zones these will be delineated in the mapping under the Protected Area Network Expansion Strategy Yet the whole process of declaring the land around the parks must be initiated by the Ministry of Housing and Lands which is the local authority to define the land uses
Regarding Mountain and River Reserves which covers approximately 6500 ha of privately managed land their status as protected areas is still unclear The Protected Area Network Expansion Strategy expected for September 2015 will provide the underpinnings for adding these reserves and other potential reserves such as the corridor of 4000 metres linking Le Morne to the Black River Gorges National Park to the protected area networks
Concerning the Native Terrestrial Biodiversity and National Parks Bill which makes provision for proclamation of of private reserves is expected to be presented to the parliament in October 2015

description.narrative: 4 Capacity development indicator score for protected area system

comment.narrative:
Systemic 50
Institutional 56
Individual 62

Systemic 78
Institutional 60
Individual 75
Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report

The Scorecard has not been applied again Hence it is not possible to inform the indicator The Capacity development indicator will be calculated after the training programme has been finalized The score generated will serve as a baseline The Capacity Development indicator will be generated a second time after training completed and the outcome will be measure against the baseline
Concerning the training need analysis the exercise is nearly completed and data analysis should start soon
Otherwise an ecological restoration workshop to share good ecosystem restoration practice through the development of a practitioners guidemanual is planned for SeptemberOctober 2015
Regarding actual training carried out during this reporting period there has been two training sessions in December 2014 on the use of GPS Staff from the Forestry services NPCS and Ministry of Housing and Lands attended the training

Concerning the training need analysis the exercise is nearly completed and data analysis should start soon
Otherwise an ecological restoration workshop to share good ecosystem restoration practice through the development of a practitioners guidemanual is planned for SeptemberOctober 2015
Regarding actual training carried out during this reporting period there has been two training sessions in December 2014 on the use of GPS Staff from the Forestry services NPCS and Ministry of Housing and Lands attended the training

description.narrative:
2 Total operational budget including HR and capital budget allocation US for protected area management
Note added to clarify that this indicator refers to the annual budget

comment.narrative: US23m
More than US41m

Target can be considered as being achieved The total budget for PAs as Government budget allocation 2014 is estimated to be 62 m for the Forestry services and 24 m include funds from PAN project approximately 800000 for the National Parks and Conservation services Additional funds of US 025 m from National Parks and conservation funds has been used for Protected Areas Other financing mechanism are also now in place such a Maurice Ile Durable MID fund to the tune of US 0 4 m for Protected Areas management Moreover funds from private companies Corporate Social Responsibility CSR have also been allocated as follows HSBC US 25000 IBL US 2500 Lions clubs US 8500 Total budget amounts to US 925 m
More than US41m

Target can be considered as being achieved The total budget for PAs as Government budget allocation 2014 is estimated to be 62 m for the Forestry services and 24 m include funds from PAN project approximately 800000 for the National Parks and Conservation services Additional funds of US 025 m from National Parks and conservation funds has been used for Protected Areas Other financing mechanism are also now in place such a Maurice Ile Durable MID fund to the tune of US 0 4 m for Protected Areas management Moreover funds from private companies Corporate Social Responsibility CSR have also been allocated as follows HSBC US 25000 IBL US 2500 Lions clubs US 8500 Total budget amounts to US 925 m

description.narrative:
9 Reach of the communications and awareness programme as follows
9a Percentage of those participating in experiential learning programmes instigated by the PAN who show enhanced knowledge
9b Percentage of those participating in experiential learning programmes instigated by the PAN who show positive changes in behavior
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014
Indicator 9 has been revised as a result of the MTR It was not being properly informed in previous reporting periods anyway
It was previously formulated as follows
Reach estimated number of people of the communications and awareness programme
The MTR recommended this changed The response was
Reach indicator does not tell us anything about the takeup of messages This indicator will be improved It will be based upon surveys of target audiences and these groups will be surveyed for changes in their knowledge attitudes and practices regarding general issues of biodiversity conservation in Mauritius and specific project protected area network objectives
Training indicators have been revised to be outcomeoriented

comment.narrative:
In order to adequately assess the target now as a of those reached out by the project tailored surveys will need to be applied
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014
The baseline for indicator 9 It was previously formulated as follows
Broadbased communications estimated number of audience receiving different media message tbd
Outreach programmes number of people attending tbd
Experiential learning programmes number of people attending tbd
Lobbying of key decisionmakers number of people and institutions tbd

9a At least 80 of those participating in experiential learning programmes show enhanced knowledge and attitude
9b At least 50 of those participating in experiential learning programmes show positive changes in behavior
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014
Target for indicator 9 It was previously formulated as follows
Broadbased communications estimated number of audience receiving different media message approx 100000
Outreach programmes number of people attending approx 500
Experiential learning programmes number of people attending approx 500
Lobbying of key decisionmakers number of people and institutions 10 of 4

Further progress have been made towards the target Since the facebook page has been created in July 2014 the number of likes has add up to 960 The awareness campaign is still being implemented with future experiential events coming A National art competition on the theme of world biodiversity was launched on the 8th May 2015 and all entries had to be submitted on the 18th May 2015 The PMU is going to do a thorough analysis of the exercise and its output to create a baselineResults from future competition will be compared to the baseline to find out whether there has been changes
In addition a national survey will be undertaken at the close of the awareness programme to look at changes in knowledge and behaviour

9a At least 80 of those participating in experiential learning programmes show enhanced knowledge and attitude
9b At least 50 of those participating in experiential learning programmes show positive changes in behavior
NOTE ON LOGFRAME REVISION 2014
Target for indicator 9 It was previously formulated as follows
Broadbased communications estimated number of audience receiving different media message approx 100000
Outreach programmes number of people attending approx 500
Experiential learning programmes number of people attending approx 500
Lobbying of key decisionmakers number of people and institutions 10 of 4

Further progress have been made towards the target Since the facebook page has been created in July 2014 the number of likes has add up to 960 The awareness campaign is still being implemented with future experiential events coming A National art competition on the theme of world biodiversity was launched on the 8th May 2015 and all entries had to be submitted on the 18th May 2015 The PMU is going to do a thorough analysis of the exercise and its output to create a baselineResults from future competition will be compared to the baseline to find out whether there has been changes
In addition a national survey will be undertaken at the close of the awareness programme to look at changes in knowledge and behaviour

description.narrative: Outcome 2 A institutional framework strengthened
10 Number of strategic plans prepared for PA institutions that are linked to the MTEF

comment.narrative:
3
Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report

There has been tangible progress towards this targetThe review of the Bras dEau National Park Management plan has been fully reviewed and will soon go for public consultation process Review of the Bras DEau operational plan has been completed in June 2015 and comments have been communicated to the International Team of Consultants for amendments
Regarding the Black River Gorges National Park9BRGNP Management plan a first draft was submitted on the 16th February 2015 An amended version together with the annual operation plan AOP was submitted in June 2015 after comments were communicated The PMU is actually driving the review of the BRGNP AOP
Concerning the strategic planning there has been continuous consultation with FS and NPCS during the different EcoAfrica missions The submission of the strategic planning should follow the PANES

3
Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report

There has been tangible progress towards this targetThe review of the Bras dEau National Park Management plan has been fully reviewed and will soon go for public consultation process Review of the Bras DEau operational plan has been completed in June 2015 and comments have been communicated to the International Team of Consultants for amendments
Regarding the Black River Gorges National Park9BRGNP Management plan a first draft was submitted on the 16th February 2015 An amended version together with the annual operation plan AOP was submitted in June 2015 after comments were communicated The PMU is actually driving the review of the BRGNP AOP
Concerning the strategic planning there has been continuous consultation with FS and NPCS during the different EcoAfrica missions The submission of the strategic planning should follow the PANES

was originally 1

Target not yet achieved There has been important progress towards it A tourism working group has been set up in September 2014 under the impulse of the International Team of Consultants The main objective of this platform is to discuss the creation of the nature based tourism association and to put a structure in place that will assist to obtain and manage concessions

description.narrative: 13 Number of private landowners concluding stewardship agreements

comment.narrative:
Informal nonbinding agreements 0
Formal legally binding agreements 0

Informal nonbinding agreements more than 6
Formal legally binding agreements more than 2

Target not yet achieved The international team of consultants has submitted a first discussion paper on Conservation stewardship in April 2015 for review and comments
The Ministry has approved the 7 Memorandun of Understanding between the private forest owners for IAS clearing and forest restoration on private lands in September 2014 The first installment was paid in January 2015 The National steering committee on the 28th May 2015 has approved to the request to increase the number of MOUs as IAS clearing is more cost effective under this scheme

Informal nonbinding agreements more than 6
Formal legally binding agreements more than 2

Target not yet achieved The international team of consultants has submitted a first discussion paper on Conservation stewardship in April 2015 for review and comments
The Ministry has approved the 7 Memorandun of Understanding between the private forest owners for IAS clearing and forest restoration on private lands in September 2014 The first installment was paid in January 2015 The National steering committee on the 28th May 2015 has approved to the request to increase the number of MOUs as IAS clearing is more cost effective under this scheme

description.narrative: 16 Extent of area ha under active IAS management and ecosystem restoration

comment.narrative: 60 ha

500 ha
Target adjusted after conclusion of inception report

Progress More than 70 of target achieved The area under conservation management area with active IAS management and ecosystem restoration achieved during this reporting period has increased to 36918 ha that is 738 of the target has been achieved Maintenance weeding has already been carried out in 6725 ha of native forestsA total of 21105 seedlings have been planted to June 2015

500 ha
